headline: How Walmart leverages e-commerce to navigate tariff challenges
summary: Retailers are struggling with shifting tariffs, and even giants like Walmart (WMT) are feeling the pressure. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma joins Market Domination to explain how Walmart is managing these challenges, highlighting the role of the company's e-commerce and advertising growth in navigating uncertainty. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: US stocks fall, 104% tariffs on China, Delta outlook: 3 things
summary: Investors gear up for another volatile trading day fueled by tariffs from US President Trump. US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are in the red ahead of the opening bell. Trump's 104% tariffs on imports from China take effect. China has retaliated with an 84% tariff rate on all imports from the US, effective on Thursday. Delta Air Lines (DAL) pulled its full-year outlook, citing uncertainty fueled by the global trade war, while Walmart (WMT) is maintaining its forecast for the year. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Walmart stands by its annual financial outlook but pulls back its 1Q view amid tariff uncertainty
summary: Walmart, the nation's largest retailer, is standing behind its full-year sales and operating income outlook even as President Donald Trump has launched tariff wars with China and nearly every trading partner that have brought a wave of economic uncertainty.  Walmart said in a release the range of outcomes has “widened due to less favorable category mix" and "the desire to maintain flexibility to invest in price as tariffs are implemented.”

headline: Trump tariffs take hold, Delta pulls guidance: Market Minute
summary: Futures are again under pressure this morning as President Trump's reciprocal tariffs go into effect. China further escalated tensions this morning and retaliated by slapping an 84% tariff on US goods. Wall Street has been under intense pressure since the White House announced the tariff plan last week, with the S&P 500 sinking nearly 12%. Major companies are scrambling in the wake of the tariffs. Delta Air Lines (DAL) pulled its guidance, citing uncertainty. Walmart (WMT) also pulled its quarterly operating income forecast. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

Delta Air Lines (DAL) pulled its guidance, citing uncertainty. Walmart (WMT) also pulled its quarterly operating income forecast. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Walmart backs annual forecasts, aims to keep prices low amid Trump tariff woes
summary: DALLAS (Reuters) -Walmart stuck to its full-year sales and income growth forecasts on Wednesday and vowed to keep prices low, even as U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs fuel fears of a global recession.  The company's shares, which have fallen nearly 9% since the announcement of a raft of tariffs on April 2, rose about 5% in early trading.  Walmart, which is the biggest U.S. importer of containerized goods, is at the risk of taking a hit from Trump's tariffs, mainly on Asian countries that supply everything from clothing to toys to the retailer.

raw.headline: Walmart backs annual forecasts, aims to keep prices low amid Trump tariff woes
raw.summary: DALLAS (Reuters) -Walmart stuck to its full-year sales and income growth forecasts on Wednesday and vowed to keep prices low, even as U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs fuel fears of a global recession.  The company's shares, which have fallen nearly 9% since the announcement of a raft of tariffs on April 2, rose about 5% in early trading.  Walmart, which is the biggest U.S. importer of containerized goods, is at the risk of taking a hit from Trump's tariffs, mainly on Asian countries that supply everything from clothing to toys to the retailer.
